title: With All U.S. Adults Eligible, How Can More Be Convinced To Get Vaccinated?
description:
Starting Monday, every person in America 16 and older is eligible to receive a COVID-19 vaccine. Nearly 40% already have. Now public health officials will begin to focus more on those who have not.

WHYY's Nina Feldman reports on the effort in Philadelphia, which is focused on racial equity.

Two groups of people who are most likely to say they won't get a shot are Republicans and white evangelical Christians. Blake Farmer of member station WPLN in Nashville reports on outreach to those groups.

In participating regions, you'll also hear from local journalists about what's happening in your community.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

itunes:title: With All U.S. Adults Eligible, How Can More Be Convinced To Get Vaccinated?
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Starting Monday, COVID-19 vaccines are available to everyone ages 16 and up. Public health officials are working to make sure as many people as possible get their shot.
itunes:subtitle: Starting Monday, COVID-19 vaccines are available to everyone ages 16 and up. Public health officials are working to make sure as many people as possible get their shot.
